rules.natural: Either the budget for the job is approved or a sponsor is found for the job.
In the event that a sponsor is found for the job, whenever it is not the opening night of the show, the tools for lighting do not work.
Either the venue is booked for the show, or, under the condition that the budget for the job is approved, if it is not the opening night of the show, then the tools for lighting are not working.
Should the technical aspects be ready for the show, then the venue is not booked for the show.
Assuming the costumes are ready for the show, it follows that the venue is not booked for the show.
Provided that the sound equipment check is done, the stage is set.
Either the sound equipment check is done or the lighting equipment check is done.
Whenever the lighting equipment check is done, the costumes are ready for the show.
In the case that the stage is set, the technical aspects are ready for the show.
If the opening of the show is postponed, then the rehearsal for the show is delayed.
Either the show is sold out or, if it is not the case that not having the props found implies the props are missing leads to the opening being postponed, then the budget for the job is extended.
Provided that the crew is available for the job, if it is not the case that not opening night of the show implies the director is rehearsing with the actors, then the show production is cancelled.

Under the condition that the staff is available for the job, should it not be true that not opening night of the show leads to the director rehearsing with the actors, then the show production is cancelled.
If the crew is hired for the job, then the crew is available for the job.
Either the crew is hired for the job or the staff is hired for the job.
Assuming the staff is hired for the job, the staff is available for the job.
In the event that the props are found, it is not the case that the props are missing.
If it is not the case that the props being found implies the props are missing, then the rehearsal for the show is not delayed.
Whenever it is not true that not having the props found implies the props are missing leads to the rehearsal being delayed, the show is on schedule.
Should it not be true that not opening night of the show implies the tools for lighting are not working, then the props are found.
Provided that it is not the opening night of the show, the tools for lighting are working.
In the event that it is not the opening night of the show, the director is not rehearsing with the actors.
